article.headline: Drexel 64, William & Mary 57
article.story: PHILADELPHIA (AP) -- Dominick Mejia scored 16 points and Scott Rodgers added 14 to lead Drexel to a 64-57 victory over William & Mary on Wednesday. Frank Elegar added 12 points and Chaz Crawford pulled down 14 rebounds for the Dragons (21-7, 12-5 Colonial Athletic Association), who have won five of six and avenged a disappointing 60-47 loss to the Tribe a week earlier. Adam Payton had 20 points for William & Mary (15-13, 8-9), which has lost two straight following a three-game winning streak. Drexel dominated the first half, shooting 60 percent from the floor to take a 40-17 halftime lead. Mejia scored 14 points in the period and Rogers added 11 points. Drexel held a 16-11 lead before going on a 24-6 run over the final seven minutes of the half. William & Mary shot just 32 percent in the opening session, including 1-of-14 from 3-point range. The Tribe finished only 6-of-25 from the arc.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).
